Swift: UINavigationBar Customized

Saturday, April 11, 2015

Overview

The UINavigationController is widely used in iOS. We’re going to look at how to customize one’s UINavigationBar. You can find more information on both of these classes here.

Content

 1 func viewDidAppear(animated: Bool) {
 2     super.viewDidAppear(animated)
 3 
 4     // cache the bar
 5     var nav = self.navigationController?.navigationBar
 6     
 7     // Change the background color of the bar
 8     nav?.barTintColor = UIColor.blueColor()
 9 
10     // Change the NavigationBar's back button color
11     nav?.tintColor = UIColor.redColor()
12 
13     // Is the bar translucent
14     nav?.translucent = true
15 
16     // Create an imageView to place instead of the NavigationBar title
17     let imageView = UIImageView(frame: CGRect(x: 0, y: 0, width: 40, height: 40))
18     imageView.contentMode = .ScaleAspectFit
19 
20     // Put an image inside the imageView
21     let image = UIImage(named: "MyImage")
22     imageView.image = image
23 
24     // place it instead of the title
25     self.navigationItem.titleView = imageView
26 }

You can find the properties of a UINavigationItem here.

You can find the properties of a UINavigationController here.
